message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with computational geometry and graph algorithms, which are covered by the cs.CG sub-category. The problem of removing local extrema from a terrain involves analyzing the structure of the terrain and identifying certain patterns, which is related to the cs.DS sub-category. The paper also involves proving hardness results, which falls under the cs.DM sub-category. The problem of removing local extrema can be viewed as a graph problem, where the vertices represent the terrain and the edges represent the connections between them, which is related to the cs.GT sub-category. Finally, the paper involves algorithmic techniques and complexity analysis, which is related to the cs.CC sub-category.
